cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 miles W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow, then turn NNW tonight and NNE on Wednesday, tracking toward Florida’s Big Bend and then across the peninsula into the western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: No official watches – interests in central/northern Florida and SE Georgia advised to monitor.
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued as of this advisory.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida peninsula and Big Bend, southeastern Georgia, and the Carolinas coast during the 5-day period.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤6%) of tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 20-30 mph possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Plaquemines Port District, LA under present track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring light to moderate showers (<2 inches).
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated that would significantly disrupt port operations.
